oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Real photo postcard of U.S. Army cooks
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This real photo postcard shows a row of six Army cooks standing behind large vats of chow. A partially obscured soldier holds a tin mess plate suggesting he is first in line for a meal. Printed on backside is CARTE POSTALE (French, Post Card). The card is not addressed or posted. Written on the reverse is "2nd from left, Fred Cook/Cook in Army." According to the family, their ancestor Fred Abel is second from left. Abel served overseas in Co. F, 322nd Inf. Regt., 81st ("Wildcat") Div.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Abel, Fred
